cards.name: Leyline of the Meek
cards.text:
If Leyline of the Meek is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it on the battlefield.
Creature tokens get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: Where strength and humility converge.

rulings.text: Leyline of the Meek gives a bonus to creatures only if they're tokens. Cards such as Clone that are copying tokens aren't tokens.

A player's "opening hand" is the hand of cards the player has after all players have taken mulligans and "scryed" if applicable. If players have any cards in hand that allow actions to be taken with them from a player's opening hand, the starting player takes all such actions first in any order, followed by each other player in turn order. Then the first turn begins.

cards.originalText:
If Leyline of the Meek is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it in play.
Creature tokens get +1/+1.

cards.name: Lionheart Maverick
cards.text:
Vigilance
{4}{W}: Lionheart Maverick gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Your signet is no symbol of power. It marks only your need for numbers to aid you. What do you do, guild-rat, now that you face my blade alone?"
cards.originalText:
Vigilance
{4}{W}: Lionheart Maverick gets +1/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Martyred Rusalka
cards.text: {W}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature can't attack this turn.
cards.flavor: Rakdos cultists hanged her for sport in the township square. Her ghost now stands vigil at what has become known as the Tree of Weeping.
cards.originalText: {W}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature can't attack this turn.

cards.name: Order of the Stars
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
As Order of the Stars enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Order of the Stars has protection from the chosen color.
cards.flavor: As stoic as the marble halls, as unblinking as the stars upon their shields.
cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
As Order of the Stars comes into play, choose a color.
Order of the Stars has protection from the chosen color.

cards.name: Shadow Lance
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has first strike.
{1}{B}: Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Shadow lances are crafted from harvested souls. The more wicked the sinner, the keener the blade.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has first strike.
{1}{B}: Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Shrieking Grotesque
cards.text:
Flying
When Shrieking Grotesque enters the battlefield, if {B} was spent to cast it, target player discards a card.
cards.flavor: Orzhov mage-sculptors bring their stone to life before they carve it. The shrieking begins as soon as the mouths are formed.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Shrieking Grotesque comes into play, if {B} was spent to play Shrieking Grotesque, target player discards a card.

cards.name: Sinstriker's Will
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals damage equal to its power to target attacking or blocking creature."
cards.flavor: "Steel rusts. Arrows break. But righteousness is always strong, always sharp."
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals damage equal to its power to target attacking or blocking creature."

cards.name: Skyrider Trainee
cards.text: Skyrider Trainee has flying as long as it's enchanted.
cards.flavor: "Of course I plan on going up. Kang here is the most trusted 'fin on the squad. Afraid? Me? No, I'm just . . . waiting for the right wind conditions."
cards.originalText: As long as Skyrider Trainee is enchanted, it has flying.

cards.name: Spelltithe Enforcer
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, that player sacrifices a permanent unless they pay {1}.
cards.flavor: His assistants calculate the amount of the tribute. He measures out the punishment for delinquency.
cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent plays a spell, that player sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {1}.

cards.name: Storm Herd
cards.text: Create X 1/1 white Pegasus creature tokens with flying, where X is your life total.
cards.flavor:
"When you hear thunder on a cloudless day, take cover and brace for the coming of the storm herd."
—Skotov, Tin Street basket vendor
cards.originalText: Put X 1/1 white Pegasus creature tokens with flying into play, where X is your life total.

cards.name: To Arms!
cards.text:
Untap all creatures you control.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"The call came, spell-borne through mortar and stone to the ear of every soldier. The call came, and the advantage was ours."
—Lodusz, captain of the watch
cards.originalText:
Untap all creatures you control.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Withstand
cards.text:
Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Defense is as much a part of war as offense, the shield as important a tool as the sword."
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage

rulings.text: You draw a card when Withstand resolves, not when damage is prevented.

cards.originalText:
Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Aetherplasm
cards.text: Whenever Aetherplasm blocks a creature, you may return Aetherplasm to its owner's hand. If you do, you may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield blocking that creature.
cards.flavor: Its fickle form holds hints of a thousand former identities.

rulings.text: Aetherplasm will return to your hand before any combat damage is assigned.

If you want, you can return Aetherplasm to your hand and not put anything onto the battlefield. The attacking creature will still be considered blocked, so it won't be able to deal combat damage to you unless it has trample or a similar ability.
The creature you put onto the battlefield may be the Aetherplasm you just returned to your hand. This allows it to dodge abilities like Deathgazer's.

The creature you put onto the battlefield from your hand is blocking the attacking creature, even if the block couldn't legally be declared (for example, if that creature enters the battlefield tapped, or it can't block, or the attacking creature has protection from it).

cards.originalText: Whenever Ætherplasm blocks a creature, you may return Ætherplasm to its owner's hand. If you do, you may put a creature card from your hand into play blocking that creature.

cards.name: Crystal Seer
cards.text:
When Crystal Seer enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
{4}{U}: Return Crystal Seer to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "Surprise is a useless, untidy emotion—the plaything of goblins and fools."
cards.originalText:
When Crystal Seer comes into play, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
{4}{U}: Return Crystal Seer to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Drowned Rusalka
cards.text: {U}, Sacrifice a creature: Discard a card, then draw a card.
cards.flavor: Lurking below the current, she thirsts until others come to drink.

rulings.text: Unlike many similar cards, Drowned Rusalka's ability causes you to discard a card first and then draw a card. If your hand is empty, you will just draw a card.

cards.originalText: {U}, Sacrifice a creature: Discard a card, then draw a card.

cards.name: Frazzle
cards.text: Counter target nonblue spell.
cards.flavor: The chant was interrupted, the components cooked, and Zok worried that it was his brain he smelled smoking.
cards.originalText: Counter target nonblue spell.

cards.name: Gigadrowse
cards.text:
Replicate {U} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Tap target permanent.
cards.originalText:
Replicate {U} (When you play this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Tap target permanent.

cards.name: Hatching Plans
cards.text: When Hatching Plans is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw three cards.
cards.flavor: So wondrous to behold, so delicate and finely crafted—and yet, such a pleasure to smash.
cards.originalText: When Hatching Plans is put into a graveyard from play, draw three cards.

cards.name: Infiltrator's Magemark
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Creatures you control that are enchanted get +1/+1 and can't be blocked except by creatures with defender.
cards.flavor:
"In secrecy is strength. None can oppose one who cannot be found."
—Szadek
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Creatures you control that are enchanted get +1/+1 and can't be blocked except by creatures with defender.

cards.name: Leyline of Singularity
cards.text:
If Leyline of Singularity is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it on the battlefield.
All nonland permanents are legendary.
cards.flavor: Where renown and solitude converge.

rulings.text: Adding a supertype doesn't overwrite other supertypes. Each nonland permanent will be legendary in addition to its other supertypes.

The "legend rule" says that if a player controls two or more legendary permanents with the same name, that player chooses one of them and the rest are put into their owners' graveyards. Notably, if you control Leyline of Singularity and two or more creature tokens with the same name, only one of the tokens will be allowed to remain on the battlefield.

If the game starts with more than one Leyline of Singularity under a single player's control, all but one of them will be put into their owners' graveyards right after the upkeep of the first turn starts. If the game started with multiple copies of any other Leylines under a single player's control, that player will also put all but one of them into their graveyard at that time.

A player's "opening hand" is the hand of cards the player has after all players have taken mulligans and "scryed" if applicable. If players have any cards in hand that allow actions to be taken with them from a player's opening hand, the starting player takes all such actions first in any order, followed by each other player in turn order. Then the first turn begins.

cards.originalText:
If Leyline of Singularity is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it in play.
All nonland permanents are legendary.

cards.name: Mimeofacture
cards.text:
Replicate {3}{U} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Choose target permanent an opponent controls. Search that player's library for a card with the same name and put it onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles their library.
cards.originalText:
Replicate {3}{U} (When you play this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Choose target permanent an opponent controls. Search that player's library for a card with the same name and put it into play under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Quicken
cards.text:
The next sorcery card you cast this turn can be cast as though it had flash. (It can be cast any time you could cast an instant.)
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: A skilled Izzet chronarch can carry out an epic vendetta between the fall of one hourglass grain and the next.

rulings.text: You don't choose a sorcery card when Quicken resolves. Rather, this sets up a rule that is true for you until the turn ends or until you cast a sorcery card, even if you cast that sorcery at a time you normally could.
If you cast multiple Quickens on the same turn, they'll all apply to the very next sorcery spell you cast.
After Quicken resolves, you can Suspend a sorcery in your hand any time you can cast an instant. As soon as you actually cast a sorcery, you lose this capability.
Casting a copy of a sorcery card won't "use up" Quicken's effect because the copy isn't a card.

cards.originalText:
The next sorcery spell you play this turn can be played any time you could play an instant.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Repeal
cards.text:
Return target nonland permanent with converted mana cost X to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Your deed cannot be undone. You, however, can be."
—Agosto, Azorius imperator
cards.originalText:
Return target nonland permanent with converted mana cost X to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Runeboggle
cards.text:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Ever try to count hyperactive schoolchildren while someone shouts random numbers in your ear? It's like that."
—Geetra, frustrated mage

rulings.text: You draw a card even if the player pays {1}.

cards.originalText:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Sky Swallower
cards.text:
Flying
When Sky Swallower enters the battlefield, target opponent gains control of all other permanents you control.
cards.flavor: Would you trade the world for such a pet?

rulings.text: Auras your opponent gains control of won't move from where they are.
The permanents don't return to your control when Sky Swallower leaves the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Sky Swallower comes into play, target opponent gains control of all other permanents you control.

cards.name: Steamcore Weird
cards.text: When Steamcore Weird enters the battlefield, if {R} was spent to cast Steamcore Weird, it deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Like many Izzet creations, weirds are based on wild contradictions yet somehow manage to work.
cards.originalText: When Steamcore Weird comes into play, if {R} was spent to play Steamcore Weird, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Stratozeppelid
cards.text:
Flying
Stratozeppelid can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: The "Days of Darkness" mark the stratozeppelids' annual migration, when for five days they blot out the sun and trumpet their passing.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Stratozeppelid can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Thunderheads
cards.text:
Replicate {2}{U} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost.)
Create a 3/3 blue Weird creature token with defender and flying. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: The clouds grew thick, and then they grew teeth.
cards.originalText:
Replicate {2}{U} (When you play this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost.)
Put a 3/3 blue Weird creature token with defender and flying into play. Remove it from the game at end of turn.

cards.name: Torch Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{R}: Torch Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Drakes? Bah! Things that breathe don't interest me. It breathes fire, you say? Well, that's a different story!"
—Zataz, Izzet clockwork artificer
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{R}: Torch Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Train of Thought
cards.text:
Replicate {1}{U} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost.)
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "But then . . . oh, but . . . which means . . . which would lead to . . . exactly!"
cards.originalText:
Replicate {1}{U} (When you play this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost.)
Draw a card.

cards.name: Vacuumelt
cards.text:
Replicate {2}{U} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
Replicate {2}{U} (When you play this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Vedalken Plotter
cards.text: When Vedalken Plotter enters the battlefield, exchange control of target land you control and target land an opponent controls.
cards.flavor: "Fair? At what point in our negotiations did you convince yourself my goal was to be fair?"

rulings.text: If either land becomes an illegal target (or leaves the battlefield) before the ability resolves, the exchange won't happen. There's no way for you to gain a land without losing another one in the process.

foreignNames.name: ヴィダルケンの策謀者

cards.originalText: When Vedalken Plotter comes into play, exchange control of target land you control and target land an opponent controls.

cards.name: Vertigo Spawn
cards.text:
Defender
Whenever Vertigo Spawn blocks a creature, tap that creature. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

rulings.text: If the creature was already tapped when Vertigo Spawn blocked it, that creature still won't untap during its controller's next untap step.

If two Vertigo Spawns block the same creature, both abilities trigger, but each only affects the creature during its controller's next untap step. The creature can untap during its controller's untap step following that one.

cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Vertigo Spawn blocks a creature, tap that creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Abyssal Nocturnus
cards.text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Abyssal Nocturnus gets +2/+2 and gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor:
"I fear to keep an open mind, for there are those who would use it as a door to my soul."
—Voka Schlak,
Mauzam Asylum inmate, diary

rulings.text: If your opponent discards any cards during their cleanup step to get down to the maximum hand size, the ability will trigger and players will receive priority. After that cleanup step ends, a new one will begin and Abyssal Nocturnus's effect will end. It won't carry over into the next turn.
If your opponent discards multiple cards to a single effect, this will trigger multiple times.

cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Abyssal Nocturnus gets +2/+2 and gains fear until end of turn.

cards.name: Caustic Rain
cards.text: Exile target land.
cards.flavor:
"Looking out the great windows of Vitu-Ghazi at the foundry stacks belching their smoke to the sky, I wonder when the sky will take its vengeance."
—Heruj, Selesnya initiate
cards.originalText: Remove target land from the game.

cards.name: Cremate
cards.text:
Exile target card from a graveyard.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Cremation of the dead is not a religious ritual in Ravnica. It's a business designed to keep the Golgari from growing in numbers.

rulings.text: You must be able to target a card in a graveyard to cast Cremate.
If the target card is no longer in the graveyard when Cremate tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Remove target card in a graveyard from the game.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Cry of Contrition
cards.text:
Target player discards a card.
Haunt (When this spell card is put into a graveyard after resolving, exile it haunting target creature.)
When the creature Cry of Contrition haunts dies, target player discards a card.
cards.originalText:
Target player discards a card.
Haunt (When this spell card is put into a graveyard after resolving, remove it from the game haunting target creature.)
When the creature Cry of Contrition haunts is put into a graveyard, target player discards a card.

cards.name: Cryptwailing
cards.text: {1}, Exile two creature cards from your graveyard: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor:
"Piece the tragic notes together and is it not a melody?"
—Teysa
cards.originalText: {1}, Remove two creature cards in your graveyard from the game: Target player discards a card. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.

cards.name: Daggerclaw Imp
cards.text:
Flying
Daggerclaw Imp can't block.
cards.flavor: The Simic use the claws as scalpels, while the Rakdos use them for tattooing and torture. The Gruul use them to pick their teeth after lunching on the rest of the carcass.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Daggerclaw Imp can't block.

cards.name: Douse in Gloom
cards.text: Douse in Gloom deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: Orzhov prisoners are steeped in a blackened brew that robs their souls of strength. Patriarchs drink that brew to extend their own lives.
cards.originalText: Douse in Gloom deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Exhumer Thrull
cards.text:
Haunt (When this creature dies, exile it haunting target creature.)
When Exhumer Thrull enters the battlefield or the creature it haunts dies, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: If you own the creature Exhumer Thrull was haunting, that creature will generally be a legal target for the haunt trigger to return to your hand.

cards.originalText:
Haunt (When this card is put into a graveyard from play, remove it from the game haunting target creature.)
When Exhumer Thrull comes into play or the creature it haunts is put into a graveyard, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Hissing Miasma
cards.text: Whenever a creature attacks you, its controller loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: All that remains when the fog finishes are neat piles of polished bones, like acid-etched glass. Orzhov servants collect them to make altar chimes.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature attacks you, its controller loses 1 life.

cards.name: Leyline of the Void
cards.text:
If Leyline of the Void is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it on the battlefield.
If a card would be put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, exile it instead.
cards.flavor: Where treachery and oblivion converge.

rulings.text: Leyline of the Void affects cards that would be put into opponents' graveyards from anywhere, not just from the battlefield.

Leyline of the Void's second ability prevents cards from ever reaching your opponents' graveyards. Abilities that would trigger when those cards are put into an opponent's graveyard (such as Hoarding Dragon's last ability) won't trigger.

Leyline of the Void's second ability doesn't affect token permanents that would be put into an opponent's graveyard from the battlefield. They'll be put into that graveyard as normal (causing any applicable triggered abilities to trigger), then they'll cease to exist.

If your opponent discards a card while you control Leyline of the Void, abilities that function when that card is discarded (such as Liliana's Caress's ability, or a madness ability of the discarded card) still work, even though that card never reaches that player's graveyard. In addition, spells or abilities that check the characteristics of the discarded card (such as Chandra Ablaze's first ability) can find that card in exile.

A player's "opening hand" is the hand of cards the player has after all players have taken mulligans and "scryed" if applicable. If players have any cards in hand that allow actions to be taken with them from a player's opening hand, the starting player takes all such actions first in any order, followed by each other player in turn order. Then the first turn begins.

cards.originalText:
If Leyline of the Void is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it in play.
If a card would be put into an opponent's graveyard, remove it from the game instead.

cards.name: Necromancer's Magemark
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Creatures you control that are enchanted get +1/+1.
If a creature you control that's enchanted would die, return it to its owner's hand instead.

rulings.text: Necromancer's Magemark returns only the creatures. The Auras attached to those creatures fall off and are put in their owner's graveyard.
Necromancer's Magemark's effect prevents the creature from ever reaching a graveyard, so abilities such as Haunt never trigger.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Creatures you control that are enchanted get +1/+1.
If a creature you control that's enchanted would be put into a graveyard, return it to its owner's hand instead.

cards.name: Orzhov Euthanist
cards.text:
Haunt (When this creature dies, exile it haunting target creature.)
When Orzhov Euthanist enters the battlefield or the creature it haunts dies, destroy target creature that was dealt damage this turn.
cards.originalText:
Haunt (When this card is put into a graveyard from play, remove it from the game haunting target creature.)
When Orzhov Euthanist comes into play or the creature it haunts is put into a graveyard, destroy target creature that was dealt damage this turn.

cards.name: Ostiary Thrull
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor: Orzhov churches don't pass the plate for collection. They charge for admission.
cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Plagued Rusalka
cards.text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Look at her, once filled with innocence. Death has a way of wringing away such . . . deficiencies."
—Savra
cards.originalText: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Poisonbelly Ogre
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, its controller loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: Some claim it's a failed Simic experiment, others say a Golgari creation. Both guilds deny all responsibility, while secretly studying its strange virulence.

rulings.text: The controller of the creature that entered the battlefield loses the life. This may or may not be the same player as Poisonbelly Ogre's controller.

cards.originalText: Whenever another creature comes into play, its controller loses 1 life.

cards.name: Restless Bones
cards.text:
{3}{B}, {T}: Target creature gains swampwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
{1}{B}: Regenerate Restless Bones.
cards.flavor:
"We mourn our dead. We shroud our dead. We bury our dead. Too often, it seems, we must kill our dead again."
—Grazda, veteran armorer
cards.originalText:
{3}{B}, {T}: Target creature gains swampwalk until end of turn.
{1}{B}: Regenerate Restless Bones.

cards.name: Revenant Patriarch
cards.text:
When Revenant Patriarch enters the battlefield, if {W} was spent to cast it, target player skips their next combat phase.
Revenant Patriarch can't block.
cards.flavor: "The Golgari raise the bodies of their dead to serve. We raise the spirits of our dead to lead."
cards.originalText:
When Revenant Patriarch comes into play, if {W} was spent to play Revenant Patriarch, target player skips his or her next combat phase.
Revenant Patriarch can't block.

cards.name: Sanguine Praetor
cards.text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy each creature with the same converted mana cost as the sacrificed creature.
cards.flavor:
"Our fealty to guilds dooms us. The old gods shall resurface. Our skins will wave upon the guild-masts over emptied streets, and our bones will clatter in the wind."
—Ilromov, traveling storyteller
cards.originalText: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy each creature with the same converted mana cost as the sacrificed creature.

cards.name: Seize the Soul
cards.text:
Destroy target nonwhite, nonblack creature. Create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
Haunt (When this spell card is put into a graveyard after resolving, exile it haunting target creature.)
When the creature Seize the Soul haunts dies, destroy target nonwhite, nonblack creature. Create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

rulings.text: A "nonwhite nonblack" creature is a creature that's neither white nor black. It can be any other color or combination of colors, or it can be colorless.
If you can't choose a nonwhite nonblack creature to target when the haunted creature is put into a graveyard, or if the target becomes illegal, you don't get a token.

cards.originalText:
Destroy target nonwhite nonblack creature. Put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying into play.
Haunt
When the creature Seize the Soul haunts is put into a graveyard, destroy target nonwhite nonblack creature. Put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying into play.

cards.name: Skeletal Vampire
cards.text:
Flying
When Skeletal Vampire enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 black Bat creature tokens with flying.
{3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a Bat: Create two 1/1 black Bat creature tokens with flying.
Sacrifice a Bat: Regenerate Skeletal Vampire.

rulings.text: You may pay the cost of Skeletal Vampire's activated abilities by sacrificing any Bat, not just a Bat token it created.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Skeletal Vampire comes into play, put two 1/1 black Bat creature tokens with flying into play.
{3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a Bat: Put two 1/1 black Bat creature tokens with flying into play.
Sacrifice a Bat: Regenerate Skeletal Vampire.

cards.name: Smogsteed Rider
cards.text: Whenever Smogsteed Rider attacks, each other attacking creature gains fear until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor:
"An entire order of mages who draw their power from Ravnica's smog? Yet another indicator of our world's decay."
—Dravash, dowsing shaman

rulings.text: The creatures gain fear before blockers can be declared.
Smogsteed Rider doesn't give itself fear, but if two are attacking, each will give the other one fear.

cards.originalText: Whenever Smogsteed Rider attacks, each other attacking creature gains fear until end of turn.

cards.name: Bloodscale Prowler
cards.text: Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
cards.flavor: It tracks its victims by the scent of their breath, preferring to dine on those who recently ate well.
cards.originalText: Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature comes into play with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Fencer's Magemark
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Creatures you control that are enchanted get +1/+1 and have first strike.
cards.flavor:
"The first blow is the most important. It often negates the need for a second."
—Agrus Kos

rulings.text: Each Magemark gives its bonus to the creature it's attached to, as long as the same player controls both the creature and the Aura.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Creatures you control that are enchanted get +1/+1 and have first strike.

cards.name: Ghor-Clan Bloodscale
cards.text:
First strike
{3}{G}: Ghor-Clan Bloodscale gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: At mealtimes, the Gruul customarily omit such niceties as using forks or killing the entrée.

rulings.text: If this card's ability is activated by one player, then another player takes control of it on the same turn, the second player can't activate its ability that turn.

foreignNames.name: Escama Sangrenta do Clã de Ghor

cards.originalText:
First strike
{3}{G}: Ghor-Clan Bloodscale gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Play this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Hypervolt Grasp
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to any target."
{1}{U}: Return Hypervolt Grasp to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Zap on. Zap off.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."
{1}{U}: Return Hypervolt Grasp to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Leyline of Lightning
cards.text:
If Leyline of Lightning is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it on the battlefield.
Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, Leyline of Lightning deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Where storm and spellcraft converge.

rulings.text: You may pay the {1} only once per spell.

If you cast a creature with bloodthirst while Leyline of Lightning is on the battlefield, you may use the Leyline's ability to deal damage to an opponent. If you do, that damage is dealt before the creature spell resolves, and the creature will enter the battlefield with counters from its bloodthirst ability.

A player's "opening hand" is the hand of cards the player has after all players have taken mulligans and "scryed" if applicable. If players have any cards in hand that allow actions to be taken with them from a player's opening hand, the starting player takes all such actions first in any order, followed by each other player in turn order. Then the first turn begins.

cards.originalText:
If Leyline of Lightning is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it in play.
Whenever you play a spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, Leyline of Lightning deals 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Living Inferno
cards.text: {T}: Living Inferno deals damage equal to its power divided as you choose among any number of target creatures. Each of those creatures deals damage equal to its power to Living Inferno.

rulings.text: You divide the damage among the target creatures as you activate Living Inferno's ability. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

The amount of damage Living Inferno will deal is locked in as you activate its ability, since you're dividing damage. If Living Inferno's power changes after its ability is activated but before it resolves (via Giant Growth, for example), the amount of damage Living Inferno deals won't change. The same is *not* true for the amount of damage dealt to Living Inferno by the other creatures, which is determined when the ability resolves.

cards.originalText: {T}: Living Inferno deals damage equal to its power divided as you choose among any number of target creatures. Each of those creatures deals damage equal to its power to Living Inferno.

cards.name: Ogre Savant
cards.text: When Ogre Savant enters the battlefield, if {U} was spent to cast Ogre Savant, return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: He's an oxymoron.

rulings.text: If {U} was spent to cast Ogre Savant and no other creatures are on the battlefield, the Ogre will have to return itself.
The ability is not optional.

cards.originalText: When Ogre Savant comes into play, if {U} was spent to play Ogre Savant, return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Parallectric Feedback
cards.text: Parallectric Feedback deals damage to target spell's controller equal to that spell's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: "You can't have so many people living so close together, all practicing so much magic, and not expect some feedback."
cards.originalText: Parallectric Feedback deals damage to target spell's controller equal to that spell's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Pyromatics
cards.text:
Replicate {1}{R} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Pyromatics deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.originalText:
Replicate {1}{R} (When you play this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Pyromatics deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Rabble-Rouser
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
{R}, {T}: Attacking creatures get +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is Rabble-Rouser's power.
cards.originalText:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature comes into play with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
{R}, {T}: Attacking creatures get +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is Rabble-Rouser's power.

cards.name: Scorched Rusalka
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice a creature: Scorched Rusalka deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Each small blaze she sets jogs her memory, letting her piece together the mystery of her own fiery end.
cards.originalText: {R}, Sacrifice a creature: Scorched Rusalka deals 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Shattering Spree
cards.text:
Replicate {R} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Destroy target artifact.
cards.originalText:
Replicate {R} (When you play this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Siege of Towers
cards.text:
Replicate {1}{R} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Target Mountain becomes a 3/1 creature. It's still a land.

rulings.text: The Mountain will remain a creature for the rest of the game. It doesn't have a creature type.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText:
Replicate {1}{R} (When you play this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Target Mountain becomes a 3/1 creature. It's still a land.

cards.name: Skarrgan Firebird
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.)
Flying
{R}{R}{R}: Return Skarrgan Firebird from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only if an opponent was dealt damage this turn.

rulings.text: You can activate Skarrgan Firebird's last ability if an opponent was dealt damage by any source, even if you didn't control that source.

cards.originalText:
Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature comes into play with three +1/+1 counters on it.)
Flying
{R}{R}{R}: Return Skarrgan Firebird from your graveyard to your hand. Play this ability only if an opponent was dealt damage this turn.

cards.name: Tin Street Hooligan
cards.text: When Tin Street Hooligan enters the battlefield, if {G} was spent to cast Tin Street Hooligan, destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: "Rauck-Chauv's like a holiday! Only it isn't on the calendars, and instead of dancing you knock people flat, and instead of giving gifts you break stuff."
cards.originalText: When Tin Street Hooligan comes into play, if {G} was spent to play Tin Street Hooligan, destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Battering Wurm
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Creatures with power less than Battering Wurm's power can't block it.

rulings.text: Battering Wurm compares each blocker's power against its own as blockers are being declared.

cards.originalText:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature comes into play with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Creatures with power less than Battering Wurm's power can't block it.

cards.name: Beastmaster's Magemark
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Creatures you control that are enchanted get +1/+1.
Whenever a creature you control that's enchanted becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

foreignNames.name: Sinal Mágico do Mestre da Besta

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Creatures you control that are enchanted get +1/+1.
Whenever a creature you control that's enchanted becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

cards.name: Bioplasm
cards.text: Whenever Bioplasm attacks, exile the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, Bioplasm gets +X/+Y until end of turn, where X is the exiled creature card's power and Y is its toughness.

rulings.text: The reminder text printed on Bioplasm is no longer correct. Abilities that define a creature's power (and toughness) apply in every zone. The value of * is defined by such an ability.

cards.originalText: Whenever Bioplasm attacks, remove the top card of your library from the game. If it's a creature card, Bioplasm gets +X/+Y until end of turn, where X is the removed creature card's power and Y is its toughness. (A * on a card not in play is 0.)

cards.name: Crash Landing
cards.text: Target creature with flying loses flying until end of turn. Crash Landing deals damage to that creature equal to the number of Forests you control.
cards.flavor:
"The other guilds think they're untouchable. It's time we brought them back down to earth."
—Ghut Rak, Gruul guildmage

rulings.text: Crash Landing can't target a creature without flying just to deal damage to it.

cards.originalText: Target creature with flying loses flying until end of turn. Crash Landing deals damage to that creature equal to the number of Forests you control.

cards.name: Dryad Sophisticate
cards.text: Nonbasic landwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a nonbasic land.)
cards.flavor: From Tin Street to the Outcast Mansions, she walks unbidden and unbound, her graceful silence never shaken by the riot of city life around her.

rulings.text: "Nonbasic landwalk" means "This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a nonbasic land." A nonbasic land is any land that lacks the basic supertype, whether or not it has a basic land type (such as Island).

cards.originalText: Nonbasic landwalk

cards.name: Earth Surge
cards.text: Each land gets +2/+2 as long as it's a creature.
cards.flavor:
"Some gardeners sing to plants. I tell them stories—stories of how they once ruled the world, of the mortals who destroyed their kind, and of revenge."
—Bougrat, druid of the Cult of Yore

rulings.text: Earth Surge gives the bonus to each permanent that has both the "land" and "creature" types. It doesn't turn lands into creatures.

cards.originalText: Each land gets +2/+2 as long as it's a creature.

cards.name: Gatherer of Graces
cards.text:
Gatherer of Graces gets +1/+1 for each Aura attached to it.
Sacrifice an Aura: Regenerate Gatherer of Graces.
cards.flavor: "Garb is for common folk. I prefer to wear insight and zeal, ambition and flame."

rulings.text: The Aura you sacrifice doesn't have to be attached to Gatherer of Graces.

If Gatherer of Graces already has damage on it equal to its toughness minus 1, then sacrificing an Aura attached to it results in Gatherer of Graces being put into its owner's graveyard before the ability that would regenerate it resolves.

cards.originalText:
Gatherer of Graces gets +1/+1 for each Aura attached to it.
Sacrifice an Aura: Regenerate Gatherer of Graces.

cards.name: Ghor-Clan Savage
cards.text: Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.)
cards.flavor: The snap of sinew. The crunch of bone. A cry for mercy. These are the music of the Gruul.
cards.originalText: Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature comes into play with three +1/+1 counters on it.)

cards.name: Gristleback
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Sacrifice Gristleback: You gain life equal to Gristleback's power.
cards.flavor: Loyal in battle, hearty in stew.
cards.originalText:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature comes into play with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Sacrifice Gristleback: You gain life equal to Gristleback's power.

cards.name: Gruul Nodorog
cards.text: {R}: Gruul Nodorog gains menace until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
cards.flavor:
Petting the nodorog
—Gruul expression meaning
"making a really big mistake"

rulings.text: Activating Gruul Nodorog's ability a second time in the same turn has no further effect.
Activating Gruul Nodorog's ability after blockers have been declared has no effect on the creatures already blocking it.

cards.originalText: {R}: Gruul Nodorog can't be blocked this turn except by two or more creatures.

cards.name: Gruul Scrapper
cards.text: When Gruul Scrapper enters the battlefield, if {R} was spent to cast Gruul Scrapper, it gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The Gruul aren't satisfied with just smashing things. They continue smashing other things with the things they just smashed.
cards.originalText: When Gruul Scrapper comes into play, if {R} was spent to play Gruul Scrapper, it gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Leyline of Lifeforce
cards.text:
If Leyline of Lifeforce is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it on the battlefield.
Creature spells can't be countered.
cards.flavor: Where sovereignty and flesh converge.

rulings.text: A player's "opening hand" is the hand of cards the player has after all players have taken mulligans and "scryed" if applicable. If players have any cards in hand that allow actions to be taken with them from a player's opening hand, the starting player takes all such actions first in any order, followed by each other player in turn order. Then the first turn begins.

cards.originalText:
If Leyline of Lifeforce is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it in play.
Creature spells can't be countered.

cards.name: Petrified Wood-Kin
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Bloodthirst X (This creature enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the damage dealt to your opponents this turn.)
Protection from instants

rulings.text: "Protection from instants" means instant spells can't target it, damage that would be dealt to it by instant sources is prevented, and it can't be the target of abilities of instants (such as Haunt).

Protection from instants works only while Petrified Wood-Kin is on the battlefield. It can be targeted by instant spells or abilities of instant cards while it's on the stack or in any other zone but on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Petrified Wood-Kin can't be countered.
Bloodthirst X (This creature comes into play with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the damage dealt to your opponents this turn.)
Protection from instants

cards.name: Predatory Focus
cards.text: You may have creatures you control assign their combat damage this turn as though they weren't blocked.
cards.flavor: Instinct blood-tinted his world until he could see only one thing clearly: his prey.

rulings.text: Will even apply to creatures that entered the battlefield after it resolved (which obviously must have Haste in order to attack).
If a creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When Predatory Focus resolves, you choose whether to use its effect or not. If you choose to use it, all your creatures will deal their combat damage to the planeswalker or defending player this turn whether or not they become blocked. You can't have any of them deal combat damage to creatures that block them. If you choose not to use its effect, nothing happens.

cards.originalText: You may have creatures you control deal their combat damage to defending player this turn as though they weren't blocked.

cards.name: Primeval Light
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments target player controls.
cards.flavor:
"Look to the old tomes, those bound in hides and written in yarberry ink. They hold the spells that can free us of the clutter of modern magecraft."
—Dravash, dowsing shaman
cards.originalText: Destroy all enchantments target player controls.

cards.name: Silhana Ledgewalker
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Silhana Ledgewalker can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: Street folk call them "spire mice," but behind the mockery is an unspoken envy of the ledgewalkers' skill at avoiding harm.

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have Flying, so they can't block this.

cards.originalText:
Silhana Ledgewalker can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.
Silhana Ledgewalker can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.

cards.name: Silhana Starfletcher
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
As Silhana Starfletcher enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color.
cards.flavor: In light he finds both gift and weapon.
cards.originalText:
As Silhana Starfletcher comes into play, choose a color.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color to your mana pool.
Silhana Starfletcher can block as though it had flying.

cards.name: Skarrgan Pit-Skulk
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Creatures with power less than Skarrgan Pit-Skulk's power can't block it.

rulings.text: Skarrgan Pit-Skulk compares each blocker's power against its own as blockers are being declared.

cards.originalText:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature comes into play with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Creatures with power less than Skarrgan Pit-Skulk's power can't block it.

cards.name: Starved Rusalka
cards.text: {G}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"No more wretched fate is there than to waste away. If you are slain, your ghost may at least avenge itself upon your killer. But what release is there for one slain by Time?"
—Ilromov, traveling storyteller
cards.originalText: {G}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Wildsize
cards.text:
Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Two times the size, four times the smell.
cards.originalText:
Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Wurmweaver Coil
cards.text:
Enchant green creature
Enchanted creature gets +6/+6.
{G}{G}{G}, Sacrifice Wurmweaver Coil: Create a 6/6 green Wurm creature token.
cards.flavor: Some use magic to spy through walls. Others use it to crush them.

rulings.text: Wurmweaver Coil can enchant only a green creature. It can't enter the battlefield attached to a nongreen creature, it can't be moved onto a nongreen creature, and if the creature it's attached to stops being green, the Aura is put into its owner's graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Enchant green creature
Enchanted creature gets +6/+6.
{G}{G}{G}, Sacrifice Wurmweaver Coil: Put a 6/6 green Wurm creature token into play.

cards.name: Agent of Masks
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent loses 1 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.
cards.flavor: "You say that I am two-faced? Enough with the flattery. We have business to conduct."
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent loses 1 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

cards.name: Angel of Despair
cards.text:
Flying
When Angel of Despair enters the battlefield, destroy target permanent.
cards.flavor:
"I feel in them a sense of duty and commitment, yet I can feel nothing else. It is as if their duty is to an empty void."
—Razia
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Angel of Despair comes into play, destroy target permanent.

cards.name: Blind Hunter
cards.text:
Flying
Haunt (When this creature dies, exile it haunting target creature.)
When Blind Hunter enters the battlefield or the creature it haunts dies, target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Haunt (When this card is put into a graveyard from play, remove it from the game haunting target creature.)
When Blind Hunter comes into play or the creature it haunts is put into a graveyard, target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Borborygmos
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Borborygmos deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"It's easy to see why those Gruul dirtbags follow him—the only orders he gives are 'Crush them!' and 'We eat!'"
—Teysa

rulings.text: Borborygmos's ability won't save your creatures that were dealt lethal damage in combat. Those creatures will be sent to your graveyard before they would get a counter.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever Borborygmos deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

cards.name: Burning-Tree Bloodscale
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
{2}{R}: Target creature can't block Burning-Tree Bloodscale this turn.
{2}{G}: Target creature blocks Burning-Tree Bloodscale this turn if able.

rulings.text: If both abilities are used on the same creature, it can't block Burning-Tree Bloodscale.

cards.originalText:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature comes into play with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
{2}{R}: Target creature can't block Burning-Tree Bloodscale this turn.
{2}{G}: Target creature blocks Burning-Tree Bloodscale this turn if able.

cards.name: Burning-Tree Shaman
cards.text: Whenever a player activates an ability that isn't a mana ability, Burning-Tree Shaman deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.flavor: Gruul shamans are bent on punishing the civilized. Any act more complex than rubbing sticks together or eating with utensils is met with the stinging burn of their magic.

rulings.text: A mana ability is an ability that adds mana to your mana pool, not one that costs mana to activate.
A mana ability is an ability that (1) isn't a loyalty ability, (2) doesn't target, and (3) could put mana into a player's mana pool when it resolves.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays an activated ability that isn't a mana ability, Burning-Tree Shaman deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.name: Castigate
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it and exile that card.
cards.flavor:
"We have no need for military might. We wield two of the sharpest swords ever forged: Faith in our left hand, Wealth in our right."
—Vuliev of the Ghost Council
cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. Choose a nonland card from it. Remove that card from the game.

cards.name: Cerebral Vortex
cards.text: Target player draws two cards, then Cerebral Vortex deals damage to that player equal to the number of cards they've drawn this turn.
cards.flavor: Izzet brains and Izzet boilers: contents under pressure.
cards.originalText: Target player draws two cards, then Cerebral Vortex deals damage to that player equal to the number of cards he or she has drawn this turn.

cards.name: Conjurer's Ban
cards.text:
Choose a card name. Until your next turn, spells with the chosen name can't be cast and lands with the chosen name can't be played.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Orzhov faithful file past to have their minds purged of "impure" desires. There, the guiltwardens eliminate any thoughts of hope or self-sufficiency.

rulings.text: Players may cast spells while Conjurer's Ban is on the stack. Only after all players pass priority does Conjurer's Ban resolve, and that's when you name a card. Once you name a card, that card can't be played in response.
You may name a land card to prevent it from being played.
Conjurer's Ban only affects cards. A copy of a card (for example, one created by Eye of the Storm isn't a card, so it can be played.
This can't be used as a counterspell. It will have no effect on spells which were on the stack when it was cast, nor on those cast in response to it.

cards.originalText:
Name a card. Until your next turn, the named card can't be played.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Culling Sun
cards.text: Destroy each creature with converted mana cost 3 or less.
cards.flavor:
"Who truly runs this city? Look to the sky on hallowed days, and see whose sigil is stamped clearly onto the heavens."
—Vuliev of the Ghost Council
cards.originalText: Destroy each creature with converted mana cost 3 or less.
